definition: when hungry, you can't pick what you eat (idiom); beggars can't be choosers/When matters are urgent, don't spend time choosing alternatives.
hungry
(negative prefix)/not/no
to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
to eat/food/animal feed/eclipse
to feed (a person or animal)

sentences.english: The dearth of returning migrants set off a desperate scramble this week to recruit workers.
sentences.chinese: 返城民工的短缺使得這周的招募工人變得飢不擇食。

sentences.english: The moose probably did what she did because she was desperate for food.
sentences.chinese: 很可能是由於飢餓，它才這麼飢不擇食的。

sentences.english: Indiscriminate eaters, Amazon horned frogs can grow to about the size of a small plate.
sentences.chinese: 飢不擇食的亞馬遜角蛙能長到一個小盤子那麼大。

definition: keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
conjoined twins
to shout loudly
(not) a single person/(no) one
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to whisper to one another's ear
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
foolish talk/nonsense
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death

to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
willingly and gladly (idiom)
